fields.label: Typography Variables
fields.name: brxc_typography_variables_repeater
fields.instructions:
In the following repeater, you can add/edit/remove your typography variables. Each row requires a label, a min value, and a max value. The label is used to create your CSS variable like var(--label). The min value is set in Pixels and represents the default value applied when reaching the minimum viewport width set in the Setting tab. The max value is also set in Pixels and represents the default max value when reaching the maximum viewport width. Keep in mind that all the pixels values will be converted in REM on frontend.
The default values are set according to the material UI font-size scale.

fields.label: Spacing Variables
fields.name: brxc_spacing_variables_repeater
fields.instructions: In the following repeater, you can add/edit/remove your spacing variables. Each row requires a label, a min value, and a max value. The label is used to create your CSS variable like var(--label). The min value is set in Pixels and represents the default value applied when reaching the minimum viewport width set in the Setting tab. The max value is also set in Pixels and represents the default max value when reaching the maximum viewport width. Keep in mind that all the pixels values will be converted in REM on frontend.

fields.label: Border-radius Variables
fields.name: brxc_border_variables_repeater
fields.instructions: In the following repeater, you can add/edit/remove your spacing variables. Each row requires a label, a min value, and a max value. The label is used to create your CSS variable like var(--label). The min value is set in Pixels and represents the default value applied when reaching the minimum viewport width set in the Setting tab. The max value is also set in Pixels and represents the default max value when reaching the maximum viewport width. Keep in mind that all the pixels values will be converted in REM on frontend.

fields.label: Misc Variables
fields.name: brxc_misc_variables_repeater
fields.instructions: In the following repeater, you can add/edit/remove your own variables. Each row requires a label and a value. The label is used to create your CSS variable like var(--label). The value has no default unit assigned - you can even add a nested CSS variable here. Sky is the limit!

fields.label: Grid Classes
fields.name: brxc_grid_builder_repeater
fields.instructions: In the following repeater, you can add/edit/remove your spacing variables. Each row requires a label, a min value, and a max value. The label is used to create your CSS variable like var(--label). The min value is set in Pixels and represents the default value applied when reaching the minimum viewport width set earlier. The max value is also set in Pixels and represents the default max value when reaching the maximum viewport width. Keep in mind that all the pixels values will be converted in REM on frontend.

fields.label: Import your Stylesheets
fields.name: brxc_class_importer_repeater
fields.instructions: In the following repeater, you can add/edit/remove your spacing variables. Each row requires a label, a min value, and a max value. The label is used to create your CSS variable like var(--label). The min value is set in Pixels and represents the default value applied when reaching the minimum viewport width set earlier. The max value is also set in Pixels and represents the default max value when reaching the maximum viewport width. Keep in mind that all the pixels values will be converted in REM on frontend.

fields.label: Add a prefix to your global CSS variables
fields.name: brxc_global_prefix
fields.instructions: The prefix will be automatically added to all your CSS variables. Example of variable generated with "p1" as prefix: --p1-gap-1.

fields.label: Base Font Size
fields.name: brxc_base_font_size
fields.instructions:
Insert the base font-size you are using on the website. This field is required in order to calculate the correct REM values. Change this value if you know what you're doing!
The default base font-size in Bricks is 10px.

fields.label: Minimum Viewport Width
fields.name: brxc_min_vw
fields.instructions:
Set the minimum viewport width where the default min value of the clamp function will apply. Above this value, the fluid formula will run until reaching the maximum viewport width.
The default value is set to 360px.

fields.label: Maximum Viewport Width
fields.name: brxc_max_vw
fields.instructions:
Set the maximum viewport width where the default max value of the clamp function will apply. Below this value, the fluid formula will run until reaching the minimum viewport width.
The default value is set to 1600px.

fields.label: Enable / Disable Elements
fields.name: brxc_enable_elements
fields.instructions: Uncheck an element to disable it completely from the whole website.

fields.label: User Roles Permissions
fields.name: brxc_user_role_permissions
fields.instructions: Select which roles should have access to your theme settings and color palettes.

fields.label: Enable Frontend Playground
fields.name: brxc_enable_gui_on_frontend
fields.instructions: Disable this option to deactivate the frontend Playground on the whole site for all users

fields.label: Frontend Playground Theme
fields.name: brxc_frontend_gui_theme
fields.instructions: Choose the Theme of the Frontend Playground

fields.label: Custom Post Types Permissions
fields.name: brxc_post_types_permissions
fields.instructions: Enable the Frontend Playground on specific custom post types.

fields.label: Replace Gutenberg Color Palettes
fields.name: brxc_enable_gutenberg_sync
fields.instructions: When this option is checked, your bricks color palettes and the Gutenberg color palettes will be synched together. Uncheck this option if you don't plan to use your custom color palettes with Gutenberg.

fields.label: Remove Default Gutenberg Presets
fields.name: brxc_remove_default_gutenberg_presets
fields.instructions: When this option is checked, the default Gutenberg presets CSS variables (like --wp--preset--color--black) won't be loaded on the frontend anymore.

fields.label: Reorder the global classes alphabetically
fields.name: brxc_reorder_global_classes
fields.instructions: Check this option if you want your global classes reordered alphabetically inside the Builder.

fields.label: Disable Styles on element ID level
fields.name: brxc_disable_id_styles
fields.instructions: Check this option if you want to disable the ability to style your elements on an ID level. In order to style your elements, you'll be forced to create a class and apply the styles on it.

fields.label: Enable CSS Variables Picker
fields.name: brxc_enable_css_variables_picker
fields.instructions: When this option is checked, you'll see a new icon popping up on the relevant style fields inside the Bricks builder. When clicked on it, the script will open a modal where you can pick the CSS variable of your choice.

fields.label: Enable Lorem Ipsum Generator
fields.name: brxc_enable_lorem_ipsum_generator
fields.instructions: When this option is checked, you'll see a new icon popping up on the relevant text/textarea fields inside the Bricks builder. When clicked on it, the script will automatically generate dummy content for that specific field.

fields.label: Type of dummy content
fields.name: brxc_lorem_type
fields.instructions: Choose between the classic Latin Lorem Ipsus text or the human-readable Website Ipsum created by Kyle Van Deusen

fields.label: Keyboard Shortcut: Open the CSS Variable modal
fields.name: brxc_shortcut_open_the_css_variable_modal

fields.label: Keyboard Shortcut: Open the CSS Stylesheets Modal
fields.name: brxc_shortcut_stylesheet

fields.label: Keyboard Shortcut: Open the Resources Modal
fields.name: brxc_shortcut_resources

fields.label: Enable Strict Editor View
fields.name: brxc_enable_strict_editor_view
fields.instructions: When enabled for a specific user role, these users won't be able to modify any styles on the pages - including drag & drop spacing and advanced settings in the left panel

fields.label: Enable the following elements on Strict Editor View
fields.name: brxc_enable_strict_editor_view_elements

fields.label: Disable the "Custom Fields" menu item in your Dashboard
fields.name: brxc_disable_acf_menu_item
fields.instructions: If for some reason you prefer to hide the ACF menu item from your Dashboard, check this toggle.

fields.label: Remove all data when uninstalling the plugin
fields.name: brxc_remove_data_uninstall
fields.instructions: Check this toggle if you want to erase all the data from your database when uninstalling the plugin. This includes all your theme options, your color palettes, and your license.
